page.title: 06Ecology
page.content: The villages of Henstead & Rushmere lie on either side of the river Hundred which reaches the sea at Benacre. An overall picture of this area is a very attractive one with large expanses of farm land interrupted by small copses, beautiful hedgerows and winding country roads. The countryside is mostly flat but it undulates softly down towards the A12 and on the B1127 just past Henstead Church. Climatically this area has had 24" annual rain for the past 7 years. The trend is to have 2 months of heavy rainfall followed by 6 weeks of dry.In the last 10 years spring has been a monty later and colder, summers have been hotter and longer, making autumn shorter.Farmers believe we could be heading for a mini ice age due to the gradual drop in sea temperature. Mist and fog are common.
